required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Normobaric Oxygen (NBO) Therapy in Acute Migraine
clinical_study.official_title: Normobaric Oxygen (NBO) Therapy in Acute Migraine

brief_summary.textblock: This is a pilot study investigating the therapeutic potential of breathing 100% oxygen in acute migraine headache.

detailed_description.textblock: A total of 40 adult subjects will be enrolled, male and female. Subjects will be consented to inhale either Normobaric Oxygen (NBO) or Room air for 30 minutes at the start of their migraine attacks. Outcomes will be assessed during and after gas treatment.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Pain Scores From 0-30 Minutes on a Visual Analog Scale (VAS)
primary_outcome.description: The mean change in VAS pain scores from 0 minutes to 30 minutes was selected as the primary outcome measure. The VAS scale has a range from 0-10 with higher scores indicating greater severity of symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Pain Score From 0-15 Minutes on the Visual Analogue Scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.description: The mean change in VAS pain scores from 0 minutes to 15 minutes was selected as a secondary outcome measure. The VAS scale has a range from 0-10 with higher scores indicating greater severity of symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Pain Score From 0-60 Minutes on the Visual Analogue Scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.description: The mean change in VAS pain scores from 0 minutes to 60 minutes was selected as a secondary outcome measure. The VAS scale has a range from 0-10 with higher scores indicating greater severity of symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Final Pain Severity Score 0-1 on the Visual Analogue Scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of migraine attacks with the final (60 minute) VAS pain score 0-1 was selected as a secondary outcome measure. The VAS scale has a range from 0-10 with higher scores indicating greater severity of symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Final Pain Score 0-1 or Score Improved 3 or More Points on the Visual Analogue Scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of migraine attacks with the final (60 minute) VAS pain score either 0-1, or a 3-point improvement from baseline, was selected as a secondary outcome measure. The VAS scale has a range from 0-10 with higher scores indicating greater severity of symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Final Visual Symptom Score 0-1 on the Visual Analog Scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of migraine attacks with the final (60 minute) VAS visual symptom score 0-1 was selected as a secondary outcome measure. The VAS scale has a range from 0-10 with higher scores indicating greater severity of symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Final Nausea Score 0-1 on the Visual Analog Scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of migraine attacks with the final (60 minute) VAS nausea score 0-1 was selected as a secondary outcome measure. The VAS scale has a range from 0-10 with higher scores indicating greater severity of symptoms.

other_outcome.description: The percentage of migraine attacks requiring the use of one or more anti-migraine medications after the period of gas inhalation, was selected as a secondary outcome measure.

arm_group.description: Oxygen is inhaled for 30 minutes during migraine attack
Medical air inhaled for 30 minutes during migraine attack

intervention.description: Oxygen is inhaled for 30 minutes during migraine attack

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult subjects with frequent migraine (at least 1 attack per month)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Secondary (non-migraine) headache
- Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease
- Pregnant

results_reference.citation: Singhal AB, Maas MB, Goldstein JN, Mills BB, Chen DW, Ayata C, Kacmarek RM, Topcuoglu MA. High-flow oxygen therapy for treatment of acute migraine: A randomized crossover trial. Cephalalgia. 2017 Jul;37(8):730-736. doi: 10.1177/0333102416651453. Epub 2016 May 20.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 22 subjects enrolled - each subject generated data for one or more migraine attacks.

group.title: Oxygen-treated Migraine Attacks
group.description: Oxygen is inhaled for 30 minutes during a migraine attack

group.title: Medical Air-treated Migraine Attacks
group.description: Medical air is inhaled for 30 minutes during a migraine attack

participants_list.participants: Each subject inhaled Oxygen for 30 minutes in blinded fashion for 2 of the 4 migraine attacks
Each subject inhaled Medical Air for 30 minutes in blinded fashion for 2 of the 4 migraine attacks

group.title: Enrolled Subjects
group.description: Oxygen or Medical Air is inhaled in random order for 30 minutes during each migraine attack (total 4 attacks)

measure.title: One or more lifetime ED visits
One or more ED visits in prior year
Using botulinum toxin for migraine prevention

outcome.title: Change in Pain Scores From 0-30 Minutes on a Visual Analog Scale (VAS)
outcome.description: The mean change in VAS pain scores from 0 minutes to 30 minutes was selected as the primary outcome measure. The VAS scale has a range from 0-10 with higher scores indicating greater severity of symptoms.
outcome.population: Number of migraine attacks treated with Oxygen or Medical Air

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were collected from the time of enrollment and until a maximum of 4 migraine attacks were treated with gas inhalation and study equipment returned to the study team.
reported_events.desc: Specific adverse events ('events of interest') were monitored around the time of each migraine attack (individual subjects had 1-4 migraine attacks each).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
